page.title: 09FARMING IN THE DOBWALLS AREA
page.content: IN THE SQUARES SOUTH OF DOBWALLS,MOST FARMING IS DAIRYING. THE LAND IS WET AND PRODUCES GOOD GRAZING.SOME LAND IS USED FOR HAY BUT MOST FOR SILAGE. POTATOES ARE ALSO GROWN AS ARE OTHER VEGETABLES. THE MILK QUOTA HAS HAD EFFECTS BOTH GOOD AND BAD. FARMERS SAY IT MAKES PLANNING EASIER, BUT THEY ARE LOOKING FOR ALTERNATIVE USES FOR THEIR LAND, WHICH COULD LEAD TO OVER PRODUCTION IN OTHER AREAS. ONE FARMER TRIED FORESTRY BUT FOUND THE LAND TOO WET. TO THE NORTH OF DOBWALLS THERE ARE MORE SHEEP,FARMERS BEING ASSISTED BY THE E.E.C.SUBSIDY FOR SHEEP LEADING TO FEARS FOR THE MARKETS FOR SHEEP AND WOOL. IN THE PAST 5 YEARS MORE AND MORE LAND HAS BEEN PLOUGHED.LOCAL FARMERS ARE PROUD OF THEIR LAND AND DEFEND THEIR RECORD ON ECOLOGY FIERCELY.
